statements.text: I can skip-count by twos, fives and tens
I can skip-count stories
I can skip-count sequences
I can count forward and backward by twos, fives and tens
I can complete skip-counting puzzles
I can complete number sequences
I can identify numbers as even or odd
I can apply arithmetic rules to determine if a number is even or odd
I can identify numbers as prime or composite numbers
I can identify ordinal numbers up to 100th
I can use number lines up to 1000
I can write numbers in words up to 100 000
I can compare numbers up to 100 000
I can pick the greatest/least number: up to 100 000
I can put numbers up to 100 000 in order
I can add one digit numbers
I can add two digit numbers
I can add three digit numbers
I can identify and use properties of addition
I can subtract one digit numbers
I can subtract two digit numbers
I can subtract three digit numbers
I can identify and use properties of Subtration
I can multiply one digit numbers
I can multiply two digit numbers
I can multiply three digit numbers
I can multiply and use properties of Multiplication
I can divide one digit numbers
I can divide two digit numbers
I can divide three digit numbers
I can divide and use properties of Division
